interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Takers [Blu-ray]
Review Date: 2013/02/12
Store: Paul Walker  (Actor),     Hayden Christensen  (Actor)    Rated:    PG-13    Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies
Product Description: ['This high-stakes action thriller stars Matt Dillon, Paul Walker, Idris Elba, Jay Hernandez, Michael Ealy and Tip “T.I.” Harris. After pulling off a spectacular series of brilliantly planned bank robberies, a notorious team of professional criminals attempts one last heist, a once-in-a-lifetime job with a $25 million payoff. And all that stands in their way is a cop hell-bent on doing whatever it takes to solve the case and bring the', 'Takers', 'down. Chris Brown and Hayden Christensen costar in an adrenaline-rushed thrill ride packed with twists and turns.']
Average Rating: 4.4
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action, Drama', 'Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Paul Walker, Hayden Christensen', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 1.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': '15423113', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 18, 2011', 'Actors': 'Paul Walker, Hayden Christensen', 'Dubbed': 'Portuguese, French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, French, English, Portuguese', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: The only true robbery is by anyone buying this movie.  It had been a long time since I've seen an action movie with such a combination of bad acting, horrible directing, a snoozer for a script and a cast that couldn't deliver their lines with any sort of skills.  Rappers, C-list movie stars and singers make up this woeful cast of 'professional' bank robbers who only 'take' the big ones... the major chase scenes are so ridiculous you will roll your eyes and shake your head as you watch them.... there was a host of reasons a sequel wasn't made.
Review Title: Ugh....
Rating: 2.0
--------------------------------------------------

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preferences:** User appears to favor action and drama genres, indicated by the choice of a high-stakes action thriller featuring a notable ensemble cast.
- **Entertainment Quality:** Shows a strong emphasis on production quality, including acting and directing. The user is critical of poor performances and mediocre scripts, as evidenced by their negative review.
- **Rating Standards:** User typically rates content relatively harshly, with a recent score of 2.0 suggesting a low tolerance for films they perceive as poorly executed. Average rating shows they may often expect above-average quality (average rating of 4.4 in general).
- **Engagement Style:** User demonstrates a blunt, straightforward approach in their reviews, favoring honesty and direct criticism over vague praise. They appreciate well-crafted narratives and performances.
- **Disappointment with Choices:** Expresses dissatisfaction with casting choices and the quality of bank heist portrayals in films, indicating a desire for authenticity in storytelling.
- **Interest in Star Power:** Despite expressing disappointment, the selection of films featuring well-known actors suggests an initial interest in star-studded casts, although this does not compensate for perceived deficiencies in execution. 

Overall, the user values high-quality production and genuine performances while maintaining a critical eye towards entertainment that doesn't meet their standards.
